description.narrative: Core support to CSE that is a NGO based in New Delhi working with issues related to environment and sustainable development. Sida has been supporting CSE since 1998. The overall objective of CSE´s work is to help improve national capacity for protection of the environment and for mitigation of and adaptation to the impacts of climate change in rural and urban India.

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2014Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The final report includes the entire project period. The project has five main objectives and have reached many and impressive results. Some examples, per objective: 1) To contribute to the development of national policies and corresponding actions aiming at a) strengthening the ability of rural communities to withstand climate change, b) sustainable urban transport and green buildings, c) sustainable water management and d) sustainable industrialisation. - Study on adaptation challenges in eco-sensitive regions such as Sunderbans resulted in a request from the state of West Bengal to work out appropriate policies and plans for affected communities. - Campaign for improving public transport resulted in bus sector reform in Delhi. - Campaign against diesel resulted in a decision by government to phase out subsidy on diesel and increase excise duty in SUVs. - Publication of the report Excreta Matters, an in-depth study on the water, sewage and sanitation situation in 72 cities in India. CSE's recommendations in the report have been incorporated in the 12th five-year plan for Industrial and Urban Water. Several states have asked CSE for support on waste water management to minimise pollution. - The Green Rating Project, which rates environmental and social performance of companies, has rated five industrial sectors and helped develop a roadmap to improve the environmental behaviour of 125 companies. 2) To contribute to capacity building and awareness of national actors (Central and State government officials and bureaucrats) and key stakeholders (civil society) in above. - Training of 215 engineers and architects in green building. - Conducted 18 training programs for environment regulators. - Recognized by the Ministry of Rural Water and Sanitation as a key resource centre in sustainable rural sanitation and drinking water. Conducted trainings and workshops. - Requested by municipal corporations for help in implementation of rainwater harvesting and wastewater treatment. - Interacted with 1500 journalists. 130 media fellowships granted, some of them receiving awards for published stories. Workshops with rural reporters. 3) To empower citizens with information on environment by creating a national portal on environment and sustainable development. - India Environment Portal is listed by national and international libraries of educational institutions as one of the "Important electronic free resource on environment" - 4.1 million visitors. 1800 subscribers for weekly newsletter. 4) To strengthen institutional capacity of CSE to provide information on environment development and awareness raising activities. -CSE has a cadre of skilled professionals, robust systems and the credibilit and visibility to influence policy and practise. - CSE's programs and interventions achieve significant outcomes and impact. - Staff members are invited to be part of important committes.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
